meanings.definition: To sell goods or services at a lower price than a competitor.
meanings.sent1: The store was undercutting its rival by offering discounts.
meanings.sent2: She decided to undercut the competition by lowering her prices.
meanings.sent3: The price wars between the two companies led to constant undercutting.
meanings.sent4: His aggressive pricing strategy was undercutting the market norms.
meanings.sent5: The tactic of undercutting proved successful in attracting more customers.

meanings.definition: To weaken or damage something, especially someone's position or power.
meanings.sent1: The constant criticism was undercutting her confidence.
meanings.sent2: His betrayal deeply undercut her trust in him.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected turn of events undercut his authority in the group.
meanings.sent4: The scandal was undercutting the politician's credibility.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments were slowly undercutting his self-esteem.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting or wearing away the lower part of something.
meanings.sent1: The constant undercutting of the riverbank caused erosion.
meanings.sent2: The gradual undercutting of the cliff made it unstable.
meanings.sent3: The relentless undercutting of the tree roots weakened its stability.
meanings.sent4: The continuous undercutting of the foundation led to structural issues.
meanings.sent5: The persistent undercutting of the rock formation created a unique shape.
